paper_abstract: The saturation number of a graph G is the cardinality of any smallest maximal matching of G. Fullerene graphs are 3-connected cubic planar graphs with exactly twelve 5-faces; all the other faces are hexagons. They are used to capture the structure of carbon molecules. Here we show that the saturation number of fullerenes on n vertices is essentially n/3.
paper_title: Sandwiching Saturation Number of Fullerene Graphs
